text: John Warner Backus (December 3, 1924 – March 17, 2007) was an American computer scientist. He directed the team that invented FORTRAN, the first widely used high-level programming language. He was the inventor of the Backus–Naur form (BNF). He received the National Medal of Science in 1975 and the 1977 ACM Turing Award. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2007 deaths Category:American computer scientists Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from Philadelphia Category:Scientists from Delaware
title: John Backus
